1.text: BEING justified therefore by faith, let us have peace with God, through our Lord Jesus Christ:

2.text: By whom also we have access through faith into this grace, wherein we stand, and glory in the hope of the glory of the sons of God.

3.text: And not only so; but we glory also in tribulations, knowing that tribulation worketh patience;

4.text: And patience trial; and trial hope;

5.text: And hope confoundeth not: because the charity of God is poured forth in our hearts, by the Holy Ghost, who is given to us.

6.text: For why did Christ, when as yet we were weak, according to the time, die for the ungodly?

7.text: For scarce for a just man will one die; yet perhaps for a good man some one would dare to die.

8.text: But God commendeth his charity towards us; because when as yet we were sinners, according to the time,

9.text: Christ died for us; much more therefore, being now justified by his blood, shall we be saved from wrath through him.

10.text: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son; much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by his life.

11.text: And not only so; but also we glory in God, through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received reconciliation.

12.text: Wherefore as by one man sin entered into this world, and by sin death; and so death passed upon all men, in whom all have sinned.

13.text: For until the law sin was in the world; but sin was not imputed, when the law was not.

14.text: But death reigned from Adam unto Moses, even over them also who have not sinned after the similitude of the transgression of Adam, who is a figure of him who was to come.

15.text: But not as the offence, so also the gift. For if by the offence of one, many died; much more the grace of God, and the gift, by the grace of one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.

16.text: And not as it was by one sin, so also is the gift. For judgment indeed was by one unto condemnation; but grace is of many offences, unto justification.

17.text: For if by one manâ€™s offence death reigned through one; much more they who receive abundance of grace, and of the gift, and of justice, shall reign in life through one, Jesus Christ.

18.text: Therefore, as by the offence of one, unto all men to condemnation; so also by the justice of one, unto all men to justification of life.

19.text: For as by the disobedience of one man, many were made sinners; so also by the obedience of one, many shall be made just.

20.text: Now the law entered in, that sin might abound. And where sin abounded, grace did more abound.

21.text: That as sin hath reigned to death; so also grace might reign by justice unto life everlasting, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
